explanation.text:
Explanation
When the phrase 'a number of' is used in a sentence, it is followed by a plural verb, hence 'have been' is the correct answer.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The police claim that a number of stolen cars ....... recovered?
subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The contracted word with a subject is 'He has'. Has is usually not contracted except it comes before 'been'
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

....... been there to look several times without success?
subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
It is grammatically correct to say 'a dangerously low level'
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The old man was rushed to hospital when his blood pressure dropped to a ....... level?
subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
The past perfect tense 'had been hoping' complete the sentences appropriately.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Until he lost the election, agbo ....... to be Student Union president?
subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Would is the past tense of 'will', therefore 'applied' is the correct answer as it is in its past tense.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

If he ....... for admission, I am sure he would succeed?

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The ....... robber showed no mercy during the attack?

explanation.text:

explanation.text:
Explanation

explanation.text:

I watched him as he ....... the hole?

explanation.text:
Explanation
grey area. A concept or topic that is not clearly defined or that exists somewhere between two extreme positions. Indeterminate territory, undefined position, neither here nor there. For example, There's a large gray area between what is legal and what is not. This term, which uses gray in the sense of “neither black nor white” (
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
In our college, the regulations concerning resits are grey area?

options.text: The regulation have just been revised
The regulations have been often ignored
The regulations are not very clear

subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Fawn is giving someone a lot of attention and praise in order to get that person's approval. Flatter means lavish praise and compliments on (someone), often insincerely and aiming to further one's own interests.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

Ogiri takes after his father, he fawns upon anyone with influence.

options.text: Like his father, Ogiri likes to flatter people with influence in society
Like his father, Ogiri hates influential people
Ogiri, who always follows his father, tries to act an influential man
Ogiri, who looks like his father, follows rich and influential people about

subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
You have been ordered to carry out an action.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
You are to write a report and give it to the security office?

options.text: After writing your report, give it to the security office
You are writing a report, as the security office directed
The report you are writing should be given to the security office
You have been ordered to write a report, which you will give to the security office

subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:
Explanation
Vindictive is having or showing a strong or unreasoning desire for revenge. This implies that there was a repression of the defeated after the war.
 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

options.text: Vengeful attacks were incessantly carried out on those who lost war
Friendly measures were taken to heal the wounds
Repressive measures were taken against those who lost the war
Those who won the war became treacherous

subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

The prefect reeled off the names of all the students who broke the library?

options.text: The prefect gave a disjointed list of the students in the law library
The prefect omitted the names of the students who broke into the law library
The prefect submitted a complete list of the students who stole library books
The prefect gave an accurate list of the students who disobeyed library regulations

subject: ENGLISH LANGUAGE

explanation.text:

I owe you far less than you owe me?

options.text: My debt to you is greater than yours to me
Your debt is not much greater than mine

I owe you something, but you owe me much more

When the bell rang, he was still speaking
The bell rang very soon after he spoke
He spoke in a harsh manner and the bell rang

having or showing a tendency to be easily annoyed

A good newspaper is one that is simple, logical, and balanced in its news coverage.

options.text: There are three laudable though unequal ways of news presentation by a daily paper
A good newspaper is that which is simple, logical and balanced in its news coverage
Press freedom is an important feature of a daily newspaper
There are three obvious functions of a daily newspaper

options.text: objectivity, simplicity and clarity are the hallmarks of good journalism
the important function of a daily newspaper is to further develop the news headlines which the radio usually produces
sensational reporting is a feature of press freedom
there can be no unbiased newspaper presentation
